io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi

Class StaticEffect.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.StaticEffect.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    StaticEffect

    public static class StaticEffect.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    The custom effect builder makes it easy to programmatically design static effects. Only one frame can be added per panel. Panels that are not set in the effect will "freeze" on the color they were before the effect is displayed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(java.util.List<Panel> panels)
      Creates a new static effect builder without requesting panel data from the device.
      Builder(NanoleafDevice device)
      Creates a new static effect builder.

    • Method Detail

      • createBuilderAsync

        public static void createBuilderAsync(NanoleafDevice device,
                                      NanoleafCallback<StaticEffect.Builder> callback)

        Asynchronously creates a new static effect builder.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        device - the target device that the effect will be displayed on
        callback - the callback to receive the builder

      • getFrames

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Frame> getFrames()
        Gets a map of the frames for this effect. The key represents the panel and the value represents the frame for the corresponding panel.
        Returns:
        a map of the frames for this effect

      • build

        public StaticEffect build(java.lang.String effectName)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Creates a new static effect using the animation data from the builder.
        Parameters:
        effectName - the desired effect name
        Returns:
        a new static effect
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException
